languages.text: Я не знаю, как они еще не спятили, сидючи посреди варп-шторма. Их там около тысячи человек — несколько сотен изгоев и отшельников, живущих на станции постоянно, и экипаж торгового судна, которое еле добралось до Скита и уже больше никуда не полетит. Они там, кажется, целыми днями только и делают, что сидят под своим хрустальным куполом, молятся, жрут консервированные пайки и пялятся на то, как реальность сходит с ума. Говорят, что Император защитит их от грядущей бури... Ну да, только на Императора им и уповать, потому как деться им со станции некуда. Мы предложили им перейти на наш корабль — ни один не согласился. Безумцы.

I don't know how they haven't gone crazy yet, sitting in the middle of this warp storm. There are around a thousand people there — a few hundred outcasts and anchorites living permanently on the station, and the crew of a trading vessel that barely made it as far as the Hermitage and won't be departing ever again. It seems they spend whole days sitting under their crystal dome praying, eating ration packs, and watching as reality loses its mind. They say the Emperor will protect them against the coming tempest... Of course they do. He is the only thing they can trust in now. For them, there is nowhere else to turn. We offered them passage on our ship — not one said yes. Mad, all of them.
languages.original_text: Я не знаю, как они еще не спятили, сидючи посреди варп-шторма. Их там около тысячи человек — несколько сотен изгоев и отшельников, живущих на станции постоянно, и экипаж торгового судна, которое еле добралось до Скита и уже больше никуда не полетит. languages.text: No sé cómo no han enloquecido en medio de esta tormenta de disformidad. Hay prácticamente un millar de personas, cientos de proscritos y anacoretas que viven permanentemente en la estación y la tripulación de una nave comercial que apenas logró llegar al Hermitage y nunca podrá salir de él. Parece que pasan sus días bajo la cúpula de cristal rezando, comiendo paquetes de raciones y viendo cómo la realidad enloquece. Dicen que el Emperador les protegerá de la tempestad que se avecina... Claro que lo dicen, su única opción es confiar en él. No tienen otra alternativa. Les ofrecimos llevarles, en nuestra nave, pero ni uno aceptó. Están todos locos.
languages.original_text: I don't know how they haven't gone crazy yet, sitting in the middle of this warp storm. There are around a thousand people there — a few hundred outcasts and anchorites living permanently on the station, and the crew of a trading vessel that barely made it as far as the Hermitage and won't be departing ever again. It seems they spend whole days sitting under their crystal dome praying, eating ration packs, and watching as reality loses its mind. They say the Emperor will protect them against the coming tempest... Of course they do. He is the only thing they can trust in now. For them, there is nowhere else to turn. We offered them passage on our ship — not one said yes. Mad, all of them.

traits.locale_text: No sé cómo no han enloquecido en medio de esta tormenta de disformidad. Hay prácticamente un millar de personas, cientos de proscritos y anacoretas que viven permanentemente en la estación y la tripulación de una nave comercial que apenas logró llegar al Hermitage y nunca podrá salir de él. Parece que pasan sus días bajo la cúpula de cristal rezando, comiendo paquetes de raciones y viendo cómo la realidad enloquece. Dicen que el Emperador les protegerá de la tempestad que se avecina... Claro que lo dicen, su única opción es confiar en él. No tienen otra alternativa. Les ofrecimos llevarles, en nuestra nave, pero ni uno aceptó. Están todos locos.

languages.text: 这群人就呆在亚空间风暴的正中心，我不知道他们怎么还没有发疯。那里大概有一千多人，其中包括几百名长期生活在星站里的流浪者和隐修士，还有一艘商船的船员。那群人勉强撑到了隐士庐，恐怕再也无法离开这里了。那些人似乎整天都躲在水晶穹顶下祈祷。他们一边吃着配给口粮，一边看着现实逐渐扭曲。他们说，帝皇会保护他们不受即将到来的风暴影响……他们当然会这么说，因为对他们而言，祂是如今唯一可以信任的存在，他们根本没有其它地方可以求援。我们说可以让他们上我们的船，但却没有一个人愿意上来。疯了，他们都疯了。
languages.original_text: I don't know how they haven't gone crazy yet, sitting in the middle of this warp storm. There are around a thousand people there — a few hundred outcasts and anchorites living permanently on the station, and the crew of a trading vessel that barely made it as far as the Hermitage and won't be departing ever again. It seems they spend whole days sitting under their crystal dome praying, eating ration packs, and watching as reality loses its mind. They say the Emperor will protect them against the coming tempest... Of course they do. He is the only thing they can trust in now. For them, there is nowhere else to turn. We offered them passage on our ship — not one said yes. Mad, all of them.

traits.locale_text: 这群人就呆在亚空间风暴的正中心，我不知道他们怎么还没有发疯。那里大概有一千多人，其中包括几百名长期生活在星站里的流浪者和隐修士，还有一艘商船的船员。那群人勉强撑到了隐士庐，恐怕再也无法离开这里了。那些人似乎整天都躲在水晶穹顶下祈祷。他们一边吃着配给口粮，一边看着现实逐渐扭曲。他们说，帝皇会保护他们不受即将到来的风暴影响……他们当然会这么说，因为对他们而言，祂是如今唯一可以信任的存在，他们根本没有其它地方可以求援。我们说可以让他们上我们的船，但却没有一个人愿意上来。疯了，他们都疯了。

languages.text: 彼らはこの〈歪み〉の嵐の真っ只中で座っていると言うのに、なぜまだ狂っていないのか分からない。ここには約1,000人の人間がいる。数百人の追放者と世捨て人がステーションに永住していて、貿易船のクルーはなんとかエルミタージュに到着して、二度とそこを出ることはない。彼らは一日中クリスタルドームに座って祈り、配給パックを食べて、現実が正気を失うのを眺めて過ごしているようだ。皇帝が来るべき嵐から彼らを守ってくれるのだと言うーーそう言う他ない。今信じられるのは皇帝だけだ。彼らにとって、他に頼れるものはない。船に乗るように勧めたけど、誰も「はい」とは言わなかった。狂っているのか、ここにいる全員が。
languages.original_text: I don't know how they haven't gone crazy yet, sitting in the middle of this warp storm. There are around a thousand people there — a few hundred outcasts and anchorites living permanently on the station, and the crew of a trading vessel that barely made it as far as the Hermitage and won't be departing ever again. It seems they spend whole days sitting under their crystal dome praying, eating ration packs, and watching as reality loses its mind. They say the Emperor will protect them against the coming tempest... Of course they do. He is the only thing they can trust in now. For them, there is nowhere else to turn. We offered them passage on our ship — not one said yes. Mad, all of them.

traits.locale_text: 彼らはこの〈歪み〉の嵐の真っ只中で座っていると言うのに、なぜまだ狂っていないのか分からない。ここには約1,000人の人間がいる。数百人の追放者と世捨て人がステーションに永住していて、貿易船のクルーはなんとかエルミタージュに到着して、二度とそこを出ることはない。彼らは一日中クリスタルドームに座って祈り、配給パックを食べて、現実が正気を失うのを眺めて過ごしているようだ。皇帝が来るべき嵐から彼らを守ってくれるのだと言うーーそう言う他ない。今信じられるのは皇帝だけだ。彼らにとって、他に頼れるものはない。船に乗るように勧めたけど、誰も「はい」とは言わなかった。狂っているのか、ここにいる全員が。

languages.text: Ich weiß nicht, wie sie noch nicht verrückt geworden sind, mitten in diesem Warpsturm. Es gibt dort etwa tausend Menschen — ein paar hundert Ausgestoßene und Ankerbewohner, die ständig auf der Station leben, und die Besatzung eines Handelsschiffs, das es gerade noch bis zur Hermitage geschafft hat und nie wieder abfliegen wird. Es scheint, als würden sie den ganzen Tag unter ihrer Kristallkuppel sitzen, beten, Rationspakete essen und zusehen, wie die Realität den Verstand verliert. Sie sagen, der Imperator wird sie vor dem kommenden Sturm beschützen... Natürlich tun sie das. Er ist das Einzige, auf das sie jetzt noch vertrauen können. Für sie gibt es keinen anderen Ausweg. Wir boten ihnen an, auf unserem Schiff mitzufahren. Keiner hat ja gesagt. Sie sind alle verrückt.
languages.original_text: I don't know how they haven't gone crazy yet, sitting in the middle of this warp storm. There are around a thousand people there — a few hundred outcasts and anchorites living permanently on the station, and the crew of a trading vessel that barely made it as far as the Hermitage and won't be departing ever again. It seems they spend whole days sitting under their crystal dome praying, eating ration packs, and watching as reality loses its mind. They say the Emperor will protect them against the coming tempest... Of course they do. He is the only thing they can trust in now. For them, there is nowhere else to turn. We offered them passage on our ship — not one said yes. Mad, all of them.

languages.text: J'ignore comment ils n'ont pas encore perdu la tête, isolés au beau milieu de cette tempête Warp. Parmi le millier de personnes là-bas, on trouve quelques centaines de parias et d'anachorètes qui ont élu domicile sur la station, et l'équipage d'un vaisseau de commerce qui est arrivé à grand peine jusqu'à l'Ermitage et qui ne repartira plus jamais. Ces gens passent des journées entières assis sous leur dôme de cristal à prier, à manger leurs rations, et à observer la réalité leur échapper. Ils affirment que l'Empereur les protégera contre la tempête à venir... Rien d'étonnant à cela, Il est le seul espoir auquel ils peuvent se raccrocher désormais. Pour eux, il n'y a aucune autre issue. Nous avons proposé de les accueillir à bord... pas un seul n'a accepté. De la folie, pure et simple.
languages.original_text: I don't know how they haven't gone crazy yet, sitting in the middle of this warp storm. There are around a thousand people there — a few hundred outcasts and anchorites living permanently on the station, and the crew of a trading vessel that barely made it as far as the Hermitage and won't be departing ever again. It seems they spend whole days sitting under their crystal dome praying, eating ration packs, and watching as reality loses its mind. They say the Emperor will protect them against the coming tempest... Of course they do. He is the only thing they can trust in now. For them, there is nowhere else to turn. We offered them passage on our ship — not one said yes. Mad, all of them.

traits.locale_text: J'ignore comment ils n'ont pas encore perdu la tête, isolés au beau milieu de cette tempête Warp. Parmi le millier de personnes là-bas, on trouve quelques centaines de parias et d'anachorètes qui ont élu domicile sur la station, et l'équipage d'un vaisseau de commerce qui est arrivé à grand peine jusqu'à l'Ermitage et qui ne repartira plus jamais. Ces gens passent des journées entières assis sous leur dôme de cristal à prier, à manger leurs rations, et à observer la réalité leur échapper. Ils affirment que l'Empereur les protégera contre la tempête à venir... Rien d'étonnant à cela, Il est le seul espoir auquel ils peuvent se raccrocher désormais. Pour eux, il n'y a aucune autre issue. Nous avons proposé de les accueillir à bord... pas un seul n'a accepté. De la folie, pure et simple.

languages.text: Bu öteboyut fırtınasının ortasında olmalarına rağmen hâlâ nasıl çıldırmadılar bilemiyorum. Yaklaşık bin kişiler: Temelli istasyonda yaşayan birkaç yüz yurtsuz ve münzevi ile İnzivagâh'a güçlükle ulaşabilmiş, bir daha hareket etmesi imkânsız bir ticaret gemisinin mürettebatı. Anlaşılan bütün günlerini kristal kubbeleri altında oturup dua ederek, kumanya yiyerek ve gerçeklikten kopuşlarını izleyerek geçiriyorlar. İmparator'un onları yaklaşan fırtınadan koruyacağını söylüyorlar. Şaşırmadım zira güvenebilecekleri bir O kaldı. Umutlarını bağlayabilecekleri başka yerleri yok. Onları gemimize alıp götürmeyi teklif ettik, hiçbiri kabul etmedi. Hepsi delirmiş.
languages.original_text: I don't know how they haven't gone crazy yet, sitting in the middle of this warp storm. There are around a thousand people there — a few hundred outcasts and anchorites living permanently on the station, and the crew of a trading vessel that barely made it as far as the Hermitage and won't be departing ever again. It seems they spend whole days sitting under their crystal dome praying, eating ration packs, and watching as reality loses its mind. They say the Emperor will protect them against the coming tempest... Of course they do. He is the only thing they can trust in now. For them, there is nowhere else to turn. We offered them passage on our ship — not one said yes. Mad, all of them.

traits.locale_text: Bu öteboyut fırtınasının ortasında olmalarına rağmen hâlâ nasıl çıldırmadılar bilmiyorum. Burada en az bin kişi var: Kalıcı olarak istasyonda yaşayan birkaç yüz yurtsuz ve münzevi ile İnzivagâh'a güçlükle ulaşabilmiş, bir daha hareket etmesi imkânsız bir ticaret gemisinin mürettebatı. Görünen o ki bütün günlerini kristal kubbeleri altında oturup dua ederek, kumanya yiyerek ve gerçeklikten kopuşlarını izleyerek geçiriyorlar. Yaklaşan fırtınaya karşı İmparator'un onları koruyacağını söylüyorlar. Şaşırtıcı değil. Artık güvenebilecekleri bir O kaldı. Umutlarını bağlayabilecekleri başka bir yer yok. Onları gemimize alıp götürmeyi teklif ettik, hiçbiri kabul etmedi. Hepsi delirmiş.
